item.title: Solve Warning: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION HAS CHANGED
item.description: Do you got an error that remote host can’t be accessed? like this? “It is also possible that a host key has just been changed.” @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @ WARNING: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION HAS CHANGED! @ @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOMEONE IS DOING SOMETHING NASTY! Someone could be eavesdropping on you right now (man-in-the-middle attack)! It is also possible that a host key has just been changed. The fingerprint for the ECDSA key sent by the remote host is SHA256:XXXX.

item.title: Handy collection of linux command
item.description: I want to save all linux command that I often needed here. Directory and Files stuff List all files with it’s sizes du -sh */ Count how many files in a dir ls -1 | wc -l Server stuff Change root password sudo passwd root Deleting specific key (hostname/IP address) at known_hosts ssh-keygen -R IP-OR-HOSTNAME
